awd_titl_txt: Knoxville College Two Campus Internet Connection
awd_abstract_narration: 9408524  Kerr  Knoxville College a Historically Black College with two campuses  requests support from NSF for connection of their two campus  networks to SURAnet.  SURAnet is the midlevel network located in  the southeastern United States.  Knoxville college has a main  campus in Knoxville, Tennessee which offers baccalaureate degrees  in 25 majors and associate degrees.  Their Morristown campus is   located 45 miles away in Morris, Tennessee.  This grant will fund  most of the external costs for the connecting to the Internet for  both campuses.  These cost are primarily for equipment and line  charges.  These connections will provide operations management and  information services and it will give the college a 56 thousand  bits per second connection to the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45  million bits per second) National Backbone network.    The college has experienced a growth in auxiliary programs that has  added value to the basic mission that the college serves to aid the  education of all persons of all ages.  The networking plan at  Knoxville College is the foundation for uniting all the disciplines  and campus groups.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
